headline.main: URUGUAY GETS WAR GOODS; U.S. Shipment Arrive -- Trade Pact to Be Signed Today

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 21 -- A reciprocal trade agreement between the United States and Uruguay was signed in Montevideo today by William Dawson, the American Ambassador, and Dr. Alberto Guani, the Uruguayan Foreign Minister.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 21 -- A reciprocal trade agreement between the United States and Uruguay was signed in Montevideo today by William Dawson, the American Ambassador, and Dr. Alberto Guani, the Uruguayan Foreign Minister.

headline.main: URUGUAY AND U.S. SIGN RECIPROCITY TREATY; Mutual Tariff Cuts and Fixed Free List Mark Accord

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 24 (AP) -- The shape of Argentine foreign policy, as illuminated by recent events, including last week's closed session of the Chamber of Deputies in Buenos Aires, was authoritatively said today to offer scant prospect of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 24 (AP) -- The shape of Argentine foreign policy, as illuminated by recent events, including last week's closed session of the Chamber of Deputies in Buenos Aires, was authoritatively said today to offer scant prospect of future concessions by Argentina in favor of the United Nations' cause.

docs.snippet: The University of Montevideo, Uruguay, will establish a Department of Philosophy in 1943, it was revealed here yesterday by Dr. Emilio Oribe, Professor of Literature in that university. Dr. Oribe, who is touring the United States as a guest of our...
docs.lead_paragraph: The University of Montevideo, Uruguay, will establish a Department of Philosophy in 1943, it was revealed here yesterday by Dr. Emilio Oribe, Professor of Literature in that university. Dr. Oribe, who is touring the United States as a guest of our State Department, said that this course would be modeled on similar courses of philosophy in Columbia, Harvard and Yale in the United States.

headline.main: Philosophy Department to Be Started At University of Montevideo in Uruguay

docs.snippet: Despite war problems, commercial credit and collection conditions in twenty-one Latin-American markets during the first half of 1942 continued the upward trend which has been noted since July, 1940, according to the semi-annual survey by the Foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite war problems, commercial credit and collection conditions in twenty-one Latin-American markets during the first half of 1942 continued the upward trend which has been noted since July, 1940, according to the semi-annual survey by the Foreign Credit Interchange Bureau of the National Association of Credit Men, released for publication today.

headline.main: LATIN CREDITTREND CONTINUED UPWARD; Improvement Was Maintained in First Half Despite War Problems, Survey Shows UNWORRIED ON FUTURE Bureau Reports That Results So Far This Year Make the Outlook Brighter

headline.main: CREW DAMAGES NAZI SHIP; Turbines Ruined on Graf Spee's Supply Vessel at Montevideo ,

docs.snippet: Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina has again been elected President of the Dominican Republic, after having been out of office for several years. Word comes from Trujillo City that he signed a decree last month authorizing the issuing of a series...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rafael Leonidas Trujillo Molina has again been elected President of the Dominican Republic, after having been out of office for several years. Word comes from Trujillo City that he signed a decree last month authorizing the issuing of a series commemorating the election.
